text:
I will be using this recipe from now on when I make chicken breasts.  I found garlic butter Ritz crackers at the store, and I love garlic, so used those and cut down the garlic salt and added a little bit of Italian seasoning. I also used an unsalted sweet butter and placed the pads around and between the chicken. Other than that, followed the recipe to a tee.  I think the time that is required to cook the chicken will depend on how many breasts you have.  I cooked at 375 for 40 minutes with 4 breasts and it turned out absolutely perfect.  It was the moistest chicken I have ever made.  I already have made this recipe 3 time within 2 weeks. Every time it turns out delicious and super moist.  I am also thinking of trying it on chicken wings and pork.  This is a very good recipe to substitute for frying.

text:
I can't wait to try this on chicken breasts. I made it last night for the kids using chicken tenderloins (hubby and I were having fajitas and they don't like them). I cooked them at 400 for 20-25 minutes. Other than that, I followed the recipe with one exception. I melted the butter and drizzled it over the chicken. Once before putting it in the oven, and again halfway through the cook time. I let them rest for a minute on a wire rack after cooking. They came out quite crisp and the kids loved them. My husband and I were eating their leftovers wishing we had this chicken instead of fajitas! Thanks for a kid approved recipe that is simple, quick and delicious.

text:
This recipe made me want to try and cook every meat that I could think of with it!! The ingredients in this recipe made this meal so delicious, delightful and delectable! My choice of chicken meat were chicken tenders. I only made slight adjustments. I had about 8 tenders, used 1 tsp of garlic salt (probably could have used a dash more) and mixed 1/4 of flour to my Progresso Italian Bread Crumb mixture vs the cracker crumbs. I could have also just used 1 beaten egg instead of 2. I let them bake for just about 40 or a lil less; bathing them individually with melted butter during half-time and towards the end. I love to make different meals and to experience a variety of flavorful foods! Thank u kindly for sharing!!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1136228.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I just had to rate this recipe! I made a few MINOR changes according to other reviewers suggestions and personal tastes but I don't think they changed the recipe very much. I used the new bacon flavored Ritz because EVERYTHING is better with bacon and crushed them into very fine crumbs. I added garlic powder instead of garlic salt because the Ritz were salty enough. And, finally, I lined the baking dish with foil for easy clean up and sprayed with nonstick cooking spray before adding the chicken and margarine (Country Crock not butter). Cooked a little less than 20 minutes because I made strips and they were golden and perfect! My SO, who is soooooo very picky, loved these. Definitely on the repeat list! I think these would be very good (except the extended cooking time unless using thick chicken breasts) exactly as is but the changes I made just made an already good thing a little better. Enjoy!

text:
This is the best recipe if you take the advice of other people:  I measure out the pepper, but I also sprinkle some on top prior to baking, I use pretty big chicken breasts so I have to cook mine for about an hour, I also cut down on the butter in the pan.  Halfway through put some melted butter on top and it gets crunchy too - this is hands down the best chicken recipe I have ever made, and I never have any leftover.

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made some changes.... First I didn't have any crackers so I used crushed up wavy lays potato chips mixed with flour in a zip lock bag along with seasoning salt, black pepper, garlic powder and red pepper because we like a kick!!! Dipped in beaten eggs than into the zip bag and than placed on the baking pan (sprayed with cooking oil) than I topped with melted butter all over and around chicken as well as minced garlic than Mozzarella cheese sprinkled on top. Put into oven for 15 minutes than I flipped it and sprinkled the garlic and cheese over the other side and placed back into oven for another 15 minutes. When taken out it was perfectly done and juicy!!! Served with Mac n cheese and salad. It was great!!! Next time I will try it with the crackers and compare but yeah it was great though would recommend to others and will make again!!! Thankyou!!!!

I actually really like this chicken and have made it numerous times and it has evolved since the first time I made it. I still use the crushed Rits crackers - I use Garlic Powder (Not Salt - there is enough salt from other sources in here.) I sometimes add additional seasonings if the mood strikes me - Chili powder - sometimes poultry seasoning.  I use Chicken Filets typically or i pound the chicken breasts very thin.  I omit the eggs and I dip them in plain greek yogurt and then in the cracker crumbs seasoning mix.   I bake them with the butter "Basting" Them a few times while cooking.  very good and flavorful.

I was requested to make fried chicken for DH's birthday. I decided to try this out instead.  It was met with skepticism...then one bite. His eyes widened, he exclaimed "Holy COW!", and began scraping the plate with his fork.  I will assume that this was a success after all.  I didn't change the recipe at all, but I did marinate the chicken in buttermilk overnight before cooking.  This is a keeper!

I did take a little from all the reviews - I did add flour, parmesan cheese and lemon pepper to bread crumbs, cut the butter in half and drizzled over breast and poured rest in small round stone to bake, mixed italian dressing to eggs and baked only for 25 minutes. city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I use chicken tenders instead of the whole breast and double the amount of crumbs.  I add about 1/2 cup of italian bread crumbs, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to the crumbs and put it all in a gallon size ziploc bag.  I dip the chicken tenders in the egg wash, press the crumbs on the chicken, dip again in the egg wash and then back in the crumbs for a crunchy crust. I also add garlic powder to the egg wash for added flavor. The chicken is moist and delicious.  Definitely a family favorite!

text:
I thought this recipe was awesome.  I did follow advice from other reviewers and cut butter to 1/3 cup.  I also used plain bread crumbs instead of crackers because I didnt have any.  I also added 2 tsp of cornstarch to the bread crumb mix so they would adhere better to the chicken.  I used a 13x9 dish sprayed with olive oil and 6 medium size chicken breasts.  I also used salted butter.  I didnt need to add any other salt to it.  I cooked it for like 30-35 minutes.  40 is too long and 25 is too little.  Very tasty.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I give this recipe 4 stars as written.  Upon reading other reviews, I added more seasoning to mine because some were complaining that the chicken was too bland.  Here is what to do if you want moist, flavorful chicken.  1: cut your chicken in half. 2. season with seasoning salt. 3. dredge the chicken in seasoned flour(I used paprika and garlic powder. 4. dip in egg seasoned as well 5. dip in finely crushed cracker crumbs.  Lastly, I added a little bit of garlic powder and paprika on top of the chicken prior to baking for 30 minutes.  I served with mashed potatoes, dinner crescents and corn.  Delish!!

Review:
Rating:
4
dateLastModified:
2012-03-08T14:52:31.773
helpfulCount:
0
userID:
5353244
Display Name:
Lucky Guy
isPro:
False
followersCount:
4
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
4
favoritesCount:
343
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1410955.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Really good start and loved the butter crackers as the breading! I'll make this again with my changes and would also try this out on pork chops.

I had 3 really thick chicken breasts which I cut in half to make 6 thinner pieces and then marinated in Italian dressing overnight.

I added Italian seasoning, 1/4 flour & garlic powder (instead of garlic salt-the crackers are salty enough) to the cracker crumbs. It took a whole roll of crackers to completely coat the 6 breasts. I cut the butter to 1/4 cup, froze it and grated it over the top before baking at another reviewers suggestion.

I moved the oven rack down to the center slot and set the timer for 30 minutes to check temp but then let it continue baking for an additional 10 minutes. It was not dry at all and tender throughout. 

I think it may have been "bland" if I'd not marinated and added seasoning to the crackers, but that's just our preference.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2012-03-08T14:39:23.57
helpfulCount:
0

text:
Fantastic dish! I did make a slight change. Instead of the cutting the butter I pre-melted it in my dish and added more garlic along with it.  I coated the breast as told but lightly dredged both sides of the each breast in the sauteed butter and garlic.  This increased taste to be uniform on all sides of the chicken.  If you are tired of dried out chicken this is the recipe for you.  This is the moisted chicken recipe I have ever made and I'm Southern!

text:
My husband made this for dinner tonight. It was VERY delicious! I read the reviews so we tweaked it a little bit. He made sure to make sure he broke up the crackers very fine so they coated the chicken well. He added more garlic and pepper and seasoned salt. I also noticed that a lot of people were saying that it was too buttery and not crunchy at all so he put it on a rack over a cookie sheet and put the butter on the pan and the chicken on a rack. Turned out flavorful, crunchy, moist. Definitely going to make this again. Thank you for the recipe.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is the best chicken I have ever made/tasted! I am not a huge fan of white meat, cause I find it too dry. But this was so juicy and flavorful! I used Pinehill chicken breasts ( can get a box of about 20 for $29.99 at Sobeys) dipped in eggs and then crushed Ritz crackers and spices. Placed the pieces in a shallow baking pan and then put the pieces of butter all around. Baked for about 40 minutes, checking it twice in between to spoon the juices over top. I have made this several times now. I love it, my husband loved it, my son loves it, my friends loved it, and my parents loved it, and they are hard to please lol. This will definately be a family favorite for years to come :)

text:
This recipe is awesome! I even had a picky eater finish his before I was done. I did make a couple changes. I marinated the breasts in Italian dressing for a couple hours. I pounded the breasts with a meat tenderizer and I used salt-free french onion dip mix and dried garlic, which I put in my magic blender to turn into powder. I added them to the cracker mixture. I only used about 3 tbsp of butter all together and added half at the beginning and half when I flipped them half way through cooking time. Definitely going to be a favorite at our house!!

This was a wonderful recipe.  While I was preparing it, I was very tempted to add to it because I thought it would not have enough flavor.  However, I was wrong.  It did need a little more salt added, but that was probably because I did not use the amount of butter they said.  I sprayed my pan with cooking spray and just used about 1/4 of a cup of butter. Thanks for the recipe!

None
text:
What a treasure of a recipe! This was absolutely delicious, my hubby and I cleaned our plates. I changed the recipe a little based on other reviews: 1/2 stick butter, plenty of garlic salt, pepper and onion powder, cooked for 30 minutes. I flattened my chicken to a 1/2 inch thickness while my husband kept his chicken breast thick, and we both agreed that mine tasted better so I definitely recommend flattening the meat. I double coated the meat, and it was crunchy and so good. Next time I will make more bread crumbs up because we ran out before I could finish double coating 2 breasts. Also, I used Town & Country crackers and they were perfect. Great recipe!

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
I really wanted to make a "fried" chicken recipe without all the oil. I didn't have any buttered flavored crackers so I just used saltines and a bit of flour mixed in. I added paprika, lemon pepper, garlic salt, and pepper to the cracker mixture. I realized after I had the chicken breaded that I was out of butter/margarine so I used some pam cooking spray instead(saved some more calories!!) . Just sprayed down the pan and the side of the chicken that was faced up. I flipped the chicken over a couple of times and put some more spray on as I went. I cooked them for about 50 minutes cause the chicken was very thick. It turned out crunchy and absolutely delicious. my family LOVED it. my husband actually told me I could make this every day if I wanted. Thanks for a great base recipe.

text:
Good recipe! Used 1/4 cup flour with cracker crumbs, used 1 stick of butter. I used more chicken cutlets then the recipe said, so the butter soaked up. I flipped them also 1/2 thru the cooking time. I will use garlic powder next time, not garlic salt, we don't generally cook with salt and it was a little to salty.I also added a little more garlic powder,some parmesean cheese would be good in the crumb mixture also. Will make again!

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was excellent! I, after reading several reviews, was worried this chicken would be a little bland. I was wrong! The ritz crackers made a delicious crust that permeated throughout the entire chicken breast. I just took a pinch of salt and garlic powder and sprinkled it on the chicken.  My only suggestions would be to cut down on the butter a little and make sure you grind up the crackers very finely. I felt it was a bit excessive as it was pooling up on the bottom of the pan and made some of the crust a bit soggy. Delicious, none-the-less.

country:
None
text:
Finally a good recipe for chicken breasts! The only reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars is because I think it needs more spice, less cooking time and, as many others have pointed out, not so much butter. I used an 8X8 pyrex dish to keep the butter on the chicken and cooked for just 30 min - 40 would definitely be too long. I also used 1/2 tsp of the following spices: salt, pepper, oregano, parsley, paprika, onion powder, and garlic powder. I did cut the butter down to 1/4 cup (1/2 stick) - though I can see how a 1/2 cup would be necessary if you were making this in a larger dish. Thanks for a great recipe to play with!

I added italian seasoning to the crumbs and parmesan cheese to the chicken as suggested.  This made the recipe a 4.  It turned out very good but as someone previously mentioned its a bit rich for an all the time recipe but it's certainly one I'll hold onto.

I've made this many times - very good.  I don't measure the butter exactly - I just put a tablespoon or so between each chicken.  Make sure to crush the crackers very small.  I put mine in a ziploc and use rolling pin to smash.  I've also used the lowfat Ritz crackers and it is just as good.  I've never made this recipe and got bad results.

This wasn’t bad- very tender, but a little bit bland in my opinion.  It just wasn’t anything special.  However, one thing that may have affected it is that I did not have any ‘butter’ crackers on hand, so I used some kind of whole grain crackers I had, so maybe that affected the flavor. If I try the recipe again, I’ll buy some butter crackers for it.

text:
This recipe was amazing!  I couldn't believe how tender the chicken was!  I used chicken fillet tenders instead and used one egg and added some milk to the egg wash.  I also jazzed it up some using seasoned salt, garlic powder instead of the garlic salt, and a dash of fresh ground sea salt.  The remaining cracker mixture, I used as a top layer to the chicken.  I also cooked it for 25 minutes as opposed to the 40 suggested.  I will make this recipe whenever I get a chance and will tell family and friends about it!

My husband LOVED this, I thought it was pretty good...used Saltines as I didn't have any Ritz but seasoned them well with onion powder, seasoned salt, garlic salt and pepper.  Dredged chicken in flour first, then egg, then cracker crumbs, sliced 1/2 stick of butter over the top and around the sides before baking then turned chicken over halfway through baking time so the top didn't dry out.  Would definitely make again, thanks for sharing!

text:
This is an easy "comfort" dinner that tastes great.  I like to use flavored croutons for the coating (favorite-- Roasted Garlic Focaccia croutons).  Just place 'em in a flat bottomed dish (I use round ones for making layered cakes) and  crush with a measuring cup.  These are easy, crunchy and add great flavor to the chicken.

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
Based on past reviews I was really hopeful with this recipe.  I just didn't think it had enough flavor to warrant the calories.  I did try it a second time and used half Ritz crackers and half fried onions.  I pulsed them in the food processor - then added more garlic salt and pepper.  I also pounded the breasts thin - adding more surface space to the chicken, thus adding more 'crumb coating' , which means more flavor.  Pounding the chicken means you only need to cook for 20 - 25 minutes.  Rewritten this way, I would give the recipe 4 stars.

text:
This was so yummy! Made a few changes...used boneless skinless thieghs (cooked for 40 minutes and they were perfect), used 1 sleeve of crackers and added about 1 t each of kosher salt, ground black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder and paprika. Also only used 1/2 of the butter. It was delicious and enjoyed by the whole family! Served with roasted carrots (that I threw in while the chicken was cooking), rice and steamed broccoli.

I noticed a lot of people said this dish was bland so I marinated for 24 hours and used garlic and herb crackers.  I also decided to half the butter because many people commented that the dish was too buttery.  After making those changes, I still found the dish to be bland and too buttery.  The chicken was very dry (even though I cut down on the cooking time)and I would have gave this dish a 1, but my boyfriend said it was "okay" so I decided to give it one extra star.  I really hate to be negative, but there are far better baked chicken recipes on this site.

text:
It was pretty good.  There are some things I will do differently next time.  Use less butter than is recommended... can get too buttery (even if you don't think that's possible).  Also, I read from another reviewer that it's good to occasionally spoon the juices (aka butter) over the chicken as it is cooking. I did that and wish that I hadn't because it was way to butter and not crunchy.  I Wanted some crunch.

text:
This was a great change of pace, but needed something. I like a lot more flavor than this recipe called for. I always make a dish the first time exactly like the recipe calls for and then if I am not thrilled, I try it again with some changes. I omitted the garlic salt, added poultry seasoning, salt, minced garlic and lots of pepper to the crackers and was more satisfied the second time around. You could also try this with Italian or Greek seasonings instead of the garlic salt for a different taste.

text:
I needed to double the crumb mixture, I used two egg whites instead of whole eggs (lowered the cholesterol) and sprayed the chicken and the pan with canola oil. Then melted the butter and drizzled it over the chicken ... I added a few thinly sliced cubes of butter around the tray. I also added a little more season salt, paprika for color and a pinch of lemon pepper.
Needed a little extra salt.  It was great! Have fun cooking.

text:
This was a great way to have a moist chicken breast! I used Keebler club crackers and 3/4 teaspoon garlic powder and several grinds of good pepper. I only used 1 egg mixed with 1 Tbs. of water for an egg wash. We had it with cheesy rice and lima beans! It was really good! Oh and I did put the margarine,not butter, on the chicken as well as around it in thin slivers for better browning.

I used the garlic butter flavored Ritz crackers for this recipe, and garlic powder instead of garlic salt, since that's all I had. I forgot to season the chicken, as other reviewers suggested, so the end result was good, but not extremely flavorful. However, served with honey mustard on the side for dipping, along with a nice side of corn and warm rolls with the honey butter from this site, it makes a very easy and tasty meal. My boyfriend and I thought it was great.

text:
This is an excellent recipe although I do a little "tweaking". First, I add a little (not too much because it's pretty salty)dry ranch dressing to the cracker mixture for extra flavor.I also reduce butter to 1/4 cup, 1/2 cup is way too much butter. Also, about halfway through cooking, I flip the chicken over so that I get butter on both sides.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I probably would have liked this better if I used full fat club crackers instead of low fat.  I also only used 4 tablespoons of butter which I can only imagine how great it would have been if I used the entire stick.  The recipe said to place the butter "around" the chicken but I think it'd be good if you placed the butter both on top and around the chicken.  I also took a reviewer's recommendation and added spices (oregano, garlic, and ground mustard) to the bag of broken up crackers.  I also put 4 cloves of garlic in the pan to cook with the chicken. I will try it again with a bit more butter and the same spices.

text:
Loved it!  I omitted the egg and melted 2-3 tablespoons of butter.  I dipped the chicken in the melted butter, and then dredged in the cracker crumbs.  Nice and buttery, not greasy at all, and I didn't have a problem with the cracher crumbs sticking.  I also just used a couple of pats of butter rather than 1/2 cup to "dot" the chicken.  Thanks so much Heather for a marvelous butter chicken that is famous with us!
